Setting Group Privileges

Depending upon your System Policy settings, group privileges can allow members of a group to access objects and perform operations that they would not otherwise be allowed to do. If the server configuration checks for privileges, they can override the application's access rights’ settings.

By default, the Administrators group has all group privileges. Also by default, other default groups (such as the All Users group) have no privileges.

If privileges are being used, all members of a group have the same privileges on every project managed by a specific server configuration. These privileges apply to all levels equally – projects, views, folders, items, and components. If users belong to more than one group, they are given the maximum amount of privileges, regardless of which group provides them with those privileges.

To set group privileges:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    These actions display the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

      • These actions display the User Manager dialog.

  4. Select the group's name on the Groups tree.

  5. Right-click to display the context menu, and select Properties. This action displays the Group Properties dialog.

  6. Select the Privileges tab.

  7. Grant privileges to or take privileges away from the group, as appropriate, by selecting and clearing the check boxes. For a list of group privileges, see below.

  8. Click OK.

Note: To change group privileges, follow the procedure outlined above.

 

List of Group Privileges

See object and its properties

See all projects, views, folders, items, and their properties.

Modify object properties

Modify the properties of any projects, views, folders, or items.

Delete object

Delete any projects, views, folders, or items.

Purge object (delete permanently)

This privilege is not supported at this time.

Acquire object ownership

This privilege is not supported at this time.

Change object access rights

Change access rights for any projects, views, folders, or items.

Create object and place it in a container

Create new objects and put them in containers. When this privilege is set, the group can add new views to a project, new folders to a view, and new folders and items to a folder. This privilege overrides the similarly named access right found in the Generic Object Rights in the Access Rights dialogs. It does not override the server-level access right that allows users to create projects.

Grant all specific class-level rights for all classes of objects

Perform any operation not covered by the preceding privileges. For example, this privilege allows group members to check out files, break locks, perform linking operations, and perform labeling operations.
